an8.35:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these eight rebirths by giving.
an8.35:1.3: First, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
an8.35:1.4: Whatever they give they expect back.
an8.35:1.5: They see a well-to-do aristocrat or brahmin or householder amusing themselves, supplied and provided with the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
an8.35:1.7: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of well-to-do aristocrats or brahmins or householders!’
an8.35:1.8: They settle on that thought, stabilize it, and develop it.
an8.35:1.9: As they’ve settled for less and not developed further, their thought leads to rebirth there.
an8.35:1.10: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of well-to-do aristocrats or brahmins or householders.
an8.35:1.11: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
an8.35:1.12: The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their purity.
an8.35:2.1: Next, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins …
an8.35:2.2: Whatever they give they expect back.
an8.35:2.4: ‘The gods of the four great kings are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
an8.35:2.6: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the gods of the four great kings!’ …
an8.35:2.9: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods of the four great kings.
an8.35:2.10: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
an8.35:2.11: The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their purity.
an8.35:3.1: Next, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins …
an8.35:3.2: Whatever they give they expect back.
an8.35:3.8: ‘The gods who control what is created by others are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
an8.35:3.10: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the gods who control what is created by others!’
an8.35:3.11: They settle on that thought, stabilize it, and develop it.
an8.35:3.12: As they’ve settled for less and not developed further, their thought leads to rebirth there.
an8.35:3.13: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods who control what is created by others.
an8.35:3.14: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
an8.35:3.15: The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their purity.
an8.35:4.1: Next, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
an8.35:4.2: Whatever they give they expect back.
an8.35:4.4: ‘The gods of the Divinity’s host are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
an8.35:4.6: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the gods of the Divinity’s host!’
an8.35:4.7: They settle on that thought, stabilize it, and develop it.
an8.35:4.8: As they’ve settled for less and not developed further, their thought leads to rebirth there.
an8.35:4.9: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods of the Divinity’s host.
an8.35:4.10: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
an8.35:4.11: And for those free of desire, not those with desire.
an8.35:4.12: The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their freedom from desire.
an8.35:4.13: These are the eight rebirths by giving.”
